Speaker: draft: march 27, 2011
Dialogue: 1.  FADE IN:  EXT. THE PLANET - MORNING  Huge mountains, destroyed STRUCTURES. Buildings enveloped by flows of earth. Awe-inspiring beauty.  JACK  Well, almost everyone.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Today we will be running support on five Resource Gatherers working the seaboard. Coordinates coming to you... now. Please do confirm. On Jack's heads-up display, five icons glow to life.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Yeah, I got 'em. You got 'em, Bob? The Bobblehead bobs.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Drone perimeter defense is intact, although one went offline last night. How's the drop?

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Oh, you know. Same ole' same. In front of Victoria, almost a hundred years of technological advances. Most prominent a MAP overlaid with environmental, meteorological, radiation levels... Other screens stream cam-footage from the Bubbleship.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Alright, you're blind in five, four, three... INTERCUT WITH JACK IN THE BUBBLESHIP. JACK watches the cloud wall RUSH UP at him.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: You should come with me sometime.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: No, thank you. Have a nice ride. The Bubbleship HITS CLOUDS, goes completely blind. Just vapor and water HAMMERING the canopy like bullets. On the heads-up display, GPS numbers roll. The readouts deal with climate, terrain below... Even in this hell, Jack takes the controls, starts to pilot on instruments. One of Victoria's boards flashes. She squints as a large MASS forms near Jack's ship.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: What do you call this? What does a storm look like inside a storm? Like this. The WALL OF WEATHER comes out of the wind and rain from behind Jack's ship, simply eats it up. Suddenly Jack's going end over end, helpless. Warning lights flash. Jack punches controls that won't respond.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: "Talkin' 'bout my girl..." Jack shifts the Bubbleship, in the distance a series of RESOURCE-GATHERERS on the horizon. Essentially titanic vacuums, sucking up the oceans. In front of her console, VICTORIA charts the Gatherers, and the patrol arcs of their defensive Drones. One blinks, stalled.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Okay, we've got another Drone downed last night.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Send it. NUMBERS FIRE across the heads-up. Jack touches a button. A BAR GAUGE begins to fill, like a street racer turning on the NOX before dragging...

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Would you like to set a course to reserve fuel?

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Yo no se. No data. It's not transmitting.  Tet coverage will go live in 11 minutes. Jack stares forward at a huge broken sign: "Home of the 2015 World Champions..."

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: You know, I actually read about this game. Giants are literally on their own seven with 25 seconds on the clock...

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Please do not reminisce on my Comm, thank you very much. He puts the Bubbleship into a soft descent. Victoria observes it on her console.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Anyway... QB lets off this mile- high bomb... The weather's fast and erratic like this. As Jack starts moving towards the Drone, a heavy mist forms, shrouding it in grey. There's almost no sound, just Jack's feet on earth...

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Jack I have no scope. The Tet is still offline. He pauses. A faint sound on the wind... like a whine.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: And at the one yard line... interception. Devastation. It's all over.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: But the guy's too eager. He starts running it back. Everyone's yelling "Fall down, just fall down!" Jack goes to his knees, examining it, his hands expertly locate an empty tube-like space on the side of the Drone.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: What do you mean taken? Was it a malfunction? Jack looks at the casing... beaten, pried open? He glances at the ground around him, the dark tunnels. REVERSE ANGLE. From inside a caved-in tunnel entrance, Jack looks small, vulnerable. Something watches Jack...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: No... It's a master drone, too. 166. Looks like it was hit mid flight, managed to limp its way here. Watch my back, I'm starting field repair. INTERCUT: VICTORIA AT SKY TOWER. Glances at the arc of the Tet's vision - still six minutes away.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Jack, you need to get out of there. Bring it home to the shop. Jack has a panel open. He pulls a lead from the sleeve of his suit, connects it to a board. We see FLIGHT DATA transfer to the Bubbleship.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: So the guy keeps running. 30, 40, 50 yards and BAM! He gets pasted. Ball goes loose...

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Jack, you know they can weaponize a fuel cell. Now a DRIVER shoots out of the tool cuff of his suit.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: I'm reading the whole central core off alignment, you don't have the necessary tools. Jack's got an arm and half his chest inside. He takes his CHEWING GUM, presses it in next to a board... Systems go green on Victoria's console.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Bob, I said I needed... He turns to find that the ROVER is already there, a DEUTERIUM FUEL CELL sitting in its payload bay. A SOUND now reaches Jack. Distant, an animal in pain? Jack listens, but it's gone. He slots the cell. A HUMMMM as the Drone powers up, systems coming online. Jack looks around at the stadium.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Hey there, boy. Easy... Jack moves forward, hand out.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Jesus, Jack. What the hell was that? INTERCUT VICTORIA. The Tet's scanners finally giving her a high-rez thermal view of Jack. Her display burning red from the residual plasma fire.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Jack, what happened? Nowtrudging to the ship:

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I'll see you at the house later. You want anything? Milk? Bread? Anything else that doesn't exist?

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: You. He leans against the ship. Smiles tired. It's a nice thing to hear.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Well if you want anybody else, you're out of luck. He boards the BUBBLESHIP.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: We only have two more months, Jack. Please try to resist the urge to do something stupid.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: No... ON JACK. The captured Drone data right there in front of him on the heads-up. He's too curious.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: There's no Drone signal there.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: One day when we get to Mars, someone will want to know about this. From someone who was here. He stares at the HUGE columns of water draining upwards.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: It's not doing anyone any good here. JACK nods, starts to turn away when something GLINTS on the horizon. He raises the Binocs, PANS to a gallows- like structure. He ZOOMS, but it is still unclear.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Actually I've got a bit of a problem with a gyro here, call you when I've fixed it. He releases a catch, pulls a WHITE RECTANGULAR CASE from a slot in the Bubbleship. He kneels down, hands working expertly, producing a full UNFOLDING MOTORCYCLE. As Jack locks the rear wheel in place, the bike HUMMS to life. He gets on and opens up the throttle, rooster- tailing off. The bike's electric, but it MOVES.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: .There you are. An instant of BLACK... And we're suddenly looking at Jack THROUGH ALIEN BINOCULARS. High tech, symbol readouts changing. Something is watching him.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Vika, you're not going to believe... WHITE NOISE on the comm. There's no signal down here.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Mission, this is Lieutenant Victoria Kohl, requesting Drone intercept at coordinates sending now. Her AUDIO goes through a SCRAMBLING PROCESS, then is uploaded where a few seconds later its receipt is acknowledged: STATUS: "APPROVED." She stares up at the map, sees one of the Drones turn towards Jack's location. She settles back, watching.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: .Jackpot.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Check your seven. Jack touches his controls and the Bubbleship Canopy REVOLVES so Jack's facing away from the direction he's traveling in. Low on the HORIZON, the TET floats in the sky. It's setting, glows a dull orange, like a Harvest Moon. INTERCUT VICTORIA. She's leaning back in her command chair, her feet propped on the console, also staring out at the Tet. Strangely quiet. In Jack's face a curious mixture of nostalgia, and confusion... This small metal planet is his home.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Goodnight, folks... See you back here tomorrow. Same time, same channel... He punches the throttle, and screams across the tops of the clouds through the beautiful light, arriving at...

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: You're not supposed to bring up surface items. JACK sips water, then waits even longer before...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: No. I'm not supposed to bring them in the house. He's right. He exchanges his water for a glass of something stronger, and goes and sits down.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: I tried to reach you earlier... If we're going to be an effective

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: You're right.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Then you can't just -- Jack leaps up, only to return a second later with a small bundle held together by an old rag. He hands it to her, pleased, watching her reaction. She opens it to reveal a small GREEN SEEDLING in a pocket of fresh, rich soil. Her eyes play over it...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Ah-ha. So it's okay when I bring you something. But if I -- She MOVES suddenly, opening one of the glass doors of the Sky Tower and heading outside where she holds the seedling away from her body, off the edge, lets it drop.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: I know you think I'm a stickler for the rules, but you have no idea what sort of toxins could be in something like that. He chuckles...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: It was just a plant, Victoria.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: That's not the point. We have two more months and the last thing we need is you putting it all at risk. He shakes his head, grimaces as he limps away.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: This is gonna pinch a little...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Hit me. She activates the wand, shines ultra violet light onto the substance. A beat, then he BENDS OVER in pain. Through the healant we see the FLESH begin to knit and repair. Skin and sinew literally regenerating... to new.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: .I'm not saying you can't go into your caverns, I'm saying we have a job and if I'm trying to reach you and you're off on one of your adventures --

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Look, they trained me to fix drones. That's my job, I get that. But it's not what I am. I can't simply do the same thing over and over again, every day, with that... world down there.  And if mission has a better Drone tech, they can get him to baby- sit. He gets up, tries out his leg. Stiff, but healed.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: It's only a little while longer. The Gatherer's have collected most of the resources we need for Mars. Pretty soon --

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Pretty soon, there won't be anything left down there. No more plant life, no more water.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: You act like there's not a war going on down there but there is and we can't leave even two of those things alive...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Actually, it was like they were trying to... catch me.  Guess I look tasty. He goes over to her, puts his arms around her.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Please be careful. If they get to you, what happens to me? JACK puts a finger to her lips, then kisses her.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Come on.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Can you imagine when we go back up? Having a face to face conversation again? I can't believe it's finally ending.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: It's not so bad down here. They certainly don't have anything like this.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: I wonder what duty I would have pulled. Probably programming the Mars boats.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I'd have been overhauling the zero- G toilets.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Stop!

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: It's awful. Just thinking about it, I get afraid... She LAUGHS, reaches for her wine, accidentally knocks the glass which tips over, and rolls right off the Sky Tower. They watch it disappear into the darkness below.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Here, let me show you... He reaches up PULLS her into the pool. She screams, laughing as she goes in. She surfaces, pulling her soaking shirt over her head and tossing it to the side.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: I should have seen that coming. Jack smiles, then takes a breath and goes under. He floats face-down, staring through the bottom of the pool into the lightening-stung clouds below... .and then Victoria's form glides underneath him, looking up at him, smiling. She stops moving and her body rises towards his. He opens his arms, and she floats up and against him. They embrace, kiss... Two bodies, intertwined underwater, a thousand feet above a roiling thunderstorm. Their lips part, he pulls back to look at her ... But it's the BRUNETTE WOMAN who stares back at him!!

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Don't go out today until we get a signal. Jack looks back. She's never said this before. She's genuinely worried.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: .Then what would you say in your report? Victoria looks away, stuck.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: One, Two, Three. Jack Harper. Lights sparkle across the board. Activation sounds. Jack hits switches. Outside, protective barriers lower. The stratospheric wind VIBRATES the bubbleship.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Just thinking I'd take Bob manual for the dust-off. Feeling the need.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: A hundred terraformed acres on Mars is all you have to think about.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Drone? Already she's got the signal analyzed on six different screens. No matches...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Don't be embarrassed, there's always a first time.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: On its way. Be careful, okay?

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: All right, I'm coming up to the location. Jack begins flying slowly up the twelve hundred foot wall of falling water which almost seems to conceal a Petra behind its veil. Jack reaches the top... JACK'S POV - THE SPIRE AND OBSERVATIONAL DECK of the EMPIRE STATE BUILDING, now part of a cliff, set in shifted sea-bed, a gushing river pouring past.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: New York, New York... It's a wonderful town. The Bronx is up, and the Battery's down... He can hear nothing over the wind and the water. He moves to the balcony edge, looks "downtown" at the sunken city. A Venice set in a matrice of rubble and sea-bed.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Jack, you're right on top of it. What do you see? Jack starts a circuit of the deck. A pile of old deck chairs in his way, he pushes at them with his foot... finds a WIRE, running below them, linked to two CAR BATTERIES, hidden under the rubbish. He traces the path of the wire... up.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Bob, give me audible on this signal. Almost immediately from the Bubbleship comes the intermittent electronic SQUACK of the signal.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: What did you find?

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: It's an old radio system. It's been reactivated.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Define reactivated. Jack looks at the batteries, the wire...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: It's the Empire State --

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: It's ancient history, Jack. You know the procedure. Blow it. He pulls several CHARGES from the Bubbleship's storage, starts to set them... He pauses, staring at the railing, the old telescope. Change of plans. He walks towards the batteries, a blade sliding out of the cuff of his suit. He reaches them and SEVERS the lines. The signal dies.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Check your course, you're headed right at the border.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Yeah, I may have seen another drone trap...

Speaker: intercut victoria
Dialogue: She checks her map. Jack's Bubbleship is headed straight at a large red swath of territory marked out, toxic radiation levels constantly monitored. A small ALARM goes off in the Bubbleship cabin.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: You're at the edge of range, Jack. You're starting to break up.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: It's okay --

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: -- will cook me from the inside before I know it. Don't worry, I'm still more than five clicks from the beacons... IN THE BUBBLESHIP. A BIGGER ALARM goes off, Red skull- and-crossbones flash across the heads-up. Jack DIVES the ship, down over huge rocky outcroppings. Jack, intent on piloting. Static. Some GARBLED SOUNDS. Victoria's voice barely coming through.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: What are -- you ---- out there Jack? The signal goes to pure static as Jack steers into a steep canyon, rock on all sides. Barely room to squeeze, but Jack's not worried. This is all familiar.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: That's right, Bob. You know where we're going.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Jack...? Victoria works the panel, upping signal, boosting reception. The static is again MIXED WITH GARBLED SOUNDS. She listens, confused, ups the volume... BLIP! That signal from the Empire State starts again. This time it LOCKS ON, a loud and continuous electronic pattern.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Jack? Jack, I really need you online...

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Mission, this is Lieutenant Victoria Kohl, requesting a link. I may have a situation... A beat while the connection is made, then...

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: I have a rogue signal of unknown origin. I'm sending you a relay.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Technician is... experiencing technical difficulties... She winces, that wasn't the greatest lie. Waits...

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Yes, we're an effective team.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Will communicate findings on next Tet cycle. Understood. Victoria clocks off. Stares at the border area on the map where she last saw Jack. A KLAXON goes off in her workspace. Victoria STARTS. For the first time she seems confused as she works the console. She can't immediately figure it out... Suddenly she brings up a WIDE SCAN for tracking the Tet, The whole Eastern Coast of the continent. And something is closing, coming over the poles, FAST.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: So, um... Victoria. The ROVER shifts, confused.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Bob! Let's get going! The Bubbleship is already powering up by the time Jack piles in. He touches a control and the ship shoots up into the air.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Vika? Vika, did you get that? An object hit near here. A ship.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Where the hell have you been? Jack's silent, not wanting to lie. INTERCUT VICTORIA, looking at streaming info from TET.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I saw it through optics in the last minute. I'm not sure it was alien.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Turn around, Jack. The Drones will handle the situation.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: The Drones'll kill anything that moves.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Just for once wait for your orders on this one, Jack. This is serious. Jack is silent, unsure. The crash site growing closer...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Vika...

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: You heard me. Another hard beat. Jack hating this but...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Negative. I'll report when I get to the site.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I'm here, and it's definitely one of ours.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: I'm not confirming this from the Tet.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I'm confirming it. I'm right here. Vika works her displays, scanning, wanting to keep him safe. The wreckage has strewn out thousands of flaming pieces of debris, all which register heat signatures.

Speaker: okay
Dialogue: SVUNK! SVUNK! Behind Jack, plasma rounds impact the Pod with the man in it, the metal going nova, collapsing...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: There are people here, and they're killing them! Victoria opens her mouth to respond. She can't.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Get out of here! Go away! Get! A moment of insane bravado, Jack un-shoulders his weapon, strafes the Drone with gunfire which knocks it back. It re-centers, weapons chugging with energy. INTERCUT VICTORIA. Staring at the feeds. A screen catching a half-image of Jack firing at the Drone. She's absolutely still, holding her breath... Jack stares at the Drone, at certain death.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: It's you...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Open it! Victoria obeys, opens the glass doors. WIND fills the living room as Jack hauls the Pod in. Then Victoria touches a control and the walls SEAL.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: She came off a NASA shuttle. The drones were specifically targeting the pods --

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: I don't know what the machinery did or didn't do. There's protocol...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Protocol? Protocol?! Who's the machinery now, Victoria? VICTORIA stares at him. Then retreats from the question into the task at hand. She kneels by the Pod.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Go get the cutter, and a breather, and my big bag. Now. The Pod's been damaged, she's not doing well, let's get her out of there. Jack moves. Victoria, almost holds back, but...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I know it does. And when we report it, we'll also report that drones slaughtered the other human survivors from one of our ships. See what they make of that. He goes for the equipment. Victoria stares at the woman's face, deeply unsettled... Jack returns with Victoria's bag, and firing up a CUTTER.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Right there, be careful... Jack directs the blue arc towards a seal. The Pod depressurizes with a sudden exhale of dead air. Jack pulls back the pod door. Inside, the woman lies in a gauzy sleep suit. Her hair is matted. Her body looks frail, her skin translucent, veins dark, lips blue, like a drowning victim. Vika pulls her feeding tube, takes her pulse, checks her eyes, lifting the lids.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: You're safe. You're in a skytower, on Earth.

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: .Jack. Victoria gives a sharp look at Jack. He's stunned. Now completely exhausted, the woman SLUMPS into unconsciousness. Jack catches her. Victoria comes close, slides an oxygen breather mask over her face.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: We need to get her cleaned up.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: We have to get her up to the Tet.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I know.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: I don't have the facilities here. Once she's stable...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I know. The glass door slides open behind them. Neither move.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: What's going on? He shakes his head. He has no idea.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Here. Drink this. You're dehydrated... You've been in a very bad crash. Your ship came down. This DISTURBS the woman. She tries to sit up.

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: What about the others? How did you get out?

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: What's your name?

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: .Julia. Julia. The woman, JULIA, sinks back down, exhausted.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: You need to rest quietly. You've been in delta sleep for a long time.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: How long...?

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Best guess? About 65 years. Julia takes that in...

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Where's Jack...? Julia STARTS. Looks down at her arm where Victoria has just slid a needle under her skin. She stares at her, almost afraid. Victoria depresses the plunger.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Shhhhhh...

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Tomorrow, I'll report that we have her. Jack nods, but won't look at her. Deep in thought.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: It's a Greek funeral vase. Which I want my ashes in, incidentally. Victoria collects the dishes, heads for the kitchen.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Jack, please. This isn't why we're here. This is just what we have to do before our real lives begin. We've given them five years and now we get to go home.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: And what if I can't? They stare at each other, each obscurely frightened.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I read these books, of what it was like down here, before... He sits, his legs dangling into the water. She pulls up close, her arms on the side.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: I know. That was the world before. Your little obsession...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: What was so wonderful about life on the Tet? She looks away...

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Please. Please. Don't you understand? We have a chance to be on the first boats out, to be the first to settle Mars, raise a family. Five years. Proof that we are an effective team.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I don't know if it is or not, Victoria. I can't remember. She starts to reply... has nothing. Shakes her head. She grabs blankets and pulls them around herself, her back to him, her eyes open, scared. Jack also lies down, staring upwards. And then Jack asks the 64,000 dollar

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: It's beautiful, isn't it? It's your home now.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: A bit more... located.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: What was your shuttle's mission? She turns to him, watches him carefully in the dim light. And then, lying:

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: I don't remember. I should get back to the ship. I might be able to find the flight recorder.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Your ship... it's pre-war.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Have you ever seen a ship like that?

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: No. No, of course not. This answers something important for Julia.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: I wonder what brought us back?

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: .There was a transmission. I don't know who sent it.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: We'll never really know without the flight recorder.  She says we can't go down there, that it's too dangerous. He laughs a little, shakes his head.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Funnily enough, you've found your man.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: How did you know my name?

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: .You look like someone I once knew.  I understand I owe you my life. Thank you, Jack. They shake. A weird moment. She breaks away, looks back at the Tet which now glows a pale orange on the horizon.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: In a few hours, the Tet will come online. Victoria will report your rescue and I imagine they'll send someone down for you.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: From... the `Pet?

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Yes. She gestures out to the Bubbleship on its pad.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: You fly that thing?

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: .You could say that. She SMILES, pleased. A twinkle in her eye...

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Alright then. Don't you want to know?

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Jack! What are you doing?

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I'll bring her back before Tet- Rise. We just want to try to find the flight recorder. You can't know everything watching from a mile up.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: She shouldn't be -- Julia turns on Victoria, quickly.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Thank you. I feel very well. Then, coldly, she boards the ship.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: She's the flight officer, she wants. to see the wreck of her ship and secure items there. You'd want to do the same thing.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Jack, please.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Don't worry, we'll be back before you have to make your report.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: That's not it. I can't protect you with the Tet offline and I just have a very bad...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I'll be fine. He turns and boards. Julia is staring at her through the bubble-canopy. The bubbleship rises and then falls off to the side, plummeting towards earth.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Jack... This isn't just about protocol. I'm trying to understand.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: So I guess I'm around... a hundred years old.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: The Scavs assumed taking out the moon would wipe us out, and it almost did. But we re-grouped, fought back. We beat them in the end. She glances at him.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: A dry planet... He nods at the Tet, rising in the distance.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Yeah. What's left of us are up there now, ready to go where you were headed, Mars. 40 acres and a mule. What we've got left. What you've got. Julia stares out at the Tet.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: What about you?

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: We were born and raised up there. Vika's the A-student. I'm just a tech... I fix things. I...

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Sorry. She stares back down at the landscape.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: No! NO! It's been taken. DAMN

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Look, it doesn't matter --

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: It matters, okay!? You don't... you can't understand... I need that flight recorder. I need to know what happened.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: We should stay close to... She ignores him, moves on. Deeper in the wreckage, she locates the empty moorings that held the Steel Cylinder Jack saw. It's also gone.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Jack! Jack! There's something coming your way. JACK!!"

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: You're staring at me.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I'm sorry. INTERCUT: Victoria watches as MORE AND MORE Alien figures pass the camera feed. Moving towards Jack and Julia's position. Victoria, HELPLESS. Julia looks up at Jack, directly for the first time. He stares at her...

Speaker: beech
Dialogue: MonteCristo, #2. Do you have any idea how long I've waited, for this? He EXHALES a stream of smoke into the beam, then moves closer, into the light. Beech's face is lined with age and exposure, his skin scarred from battle. His teeth yellowed and crooked, but his arms and body are strong. Jack TENSES. Beech's voice is calm, with a barely held- back malice lurking just under the surface.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Who are you? Where is this? BEECH inhales again. There's a piercing curiosity to Beech's gaze, studying him.

Speaker: beech
Dialogue: We're deep underground. Very deep underground.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: We were taken by the Scavs...

Speaker: beech
Dialogue: Oh... The "Scavs".

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: The Scavs took everything from us. And if you're working with them --

Speaker: beech
Dialogue: Interesting, Jack. Interesting. You're worried I might be some kind of... Collaborator. Jack doesn't respond.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: No, they're programmed to

Speaker: beech
Dialogue: To what, Jack?

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Anyone would have...

Speaker: beech
Dialogue: Anyone. Would have. Interesting. Julia comes around, her eyes flickering open, She SCREAMS, looking frantically for an escape. Jack GRABS her, protecting her, calming her. Beech gets CLOSE, studies Jack, what he's doing. Nods.

Speaker: beech
Dialogue: We grow what we can, under the lights. It isn't much; Wheat- grass, some vegetables, what beans and soy we can. The general state of our health proves that human beings are not herbivores, but the alternative is not appetizing to anybody.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: When we get you up to the Tet, there's plenty -

Speaker: beech
Dialogue: There is? Plenty. Plenty of what?

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Food.Foreveryone.

Speaker: beech
Dialogue: The zones... the area you don't patrol...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: No one does. You go there ---

Speaker: beech
Dialogue: -- Your organs boil from the inside. I've heard. Beech moves on, turning down another corridor. There are PAINTINGS, stacked against the walls. Picasso, Monet, Kandinsky, Warhol. SCULPTURES in piles.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: It reminds me of home...

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: He's disappeared.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: .Six hours.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: The Scavs took him. I witnessed it. He has a... A beat. Victoria experiencing jealousy she didn't fully understand before...

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: I told you, she's with the Technical Officer. I'm requesting permission to re-task the Drones for search and rescue.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Jack, what he said about the Tet...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: It took three decades to build the Tet. And when it was finally ready and it was time to go up, there were people who refused. Leaders, who told their people to stay. Staring at Beech, the glint in the man's eyes...

Speaker: victoria's voice
Dialogue: Jack! Jack! There's something coming your way. JACK!!!! Victoria LISTENS, chilled. She hits REWIND, then PLAY:

Speaker: jack's voice
Dialogue: .It'll be fine. Trust me.

Speaker: victoria's voice
Dialogue: I'm trying to.

Speaker: jack's voice
Dialogue: I'll be home for breakfast. Alone in the Sky Tower, this hits Victoria hard. REWIND. Victoria STARES at the counter, letting it go further back. Then, PLAY. Just STATIC. Then we hear Victoria's end of a conversation we already witnessed:

Speaker: victoria's voice
Dialogue: What are you doing out there so far, Jack? Then the static for a moment filled with GARBLED SOUNDS. Victoria hits STOP. She stares. Makes an adjustment, plays the SOUNDS again. Something drawing her in...

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: The bomb... She REALIZES something, wheels on Beech, angry.

Speaker: beech
Dialogue: I know what I did. But tell us, Commander, why did you have a bomb on board, what was it for? Tell him. She looks at Jack, reluctant to say it, but...

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: The Tet... is an alien ship, Jack. The odyssey's mission --- Our mission, was to investigate it. Jack shakes his head no. Angry...

Speaker: beech
Dialogue: It attacked us. First it destroyed our moon. Then it unleashed its primary weapon, a brilliant weapon...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I was born there!

Speaker: beech
Dialogue: I was born in Chicago, Jack. I used to go to baseball games with my father. I used to get two big hot dogs, fill 'em up with relish, and mustard. Just go to town. Me and my pops, watching the sox.  You have any memories like that Jack?

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: No, my father was a --

Speaker: beech
Dialogue: Was what? Tall? Fat? He yell at your mom? Ever go to a baseball game, Jack?

Speaker: beech
Dialogue: Right, sorry. Tell me how your mother smelled.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: beech
Dialogue: My mother, smelled like warm fruit. Like oranges, sitting in the sun. Jack starts to speak... Stops. Beech moves to one of the scavenged DELTA SLEEP PODS, runs his hand over the embossed name-plate...

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: It was you, Jack.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: You and Victoria. We were all on the Odyssey. We were supposed to make contact...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: beech
Dialogue: The Tet is an alien vessel, Commander Jack Harper. It came and destroyed our moon and most of humanity when it did. And ever since, with your help, it's been trying to finish the job.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: You're insane. This is insane. He turns to Julia, but she won't help him.

Speaker: beech
Dialogue: What? People like you? We are the last real people.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: It followed him here. I told you this was a mistake! Beech, processing. All around the periphery, REACTION. This is a disaster.

Speaker: beech
Dialogue: Well well, we may be out of time. Set the Drone to return to the Tet upon reactivation. It needs to go right to the center --

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: No! It will kill -

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: No. I won't do it.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: He won't help us. We bury them both, make our run as soon as we can load up.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: You know I stare into weapons every day, so you can put that away. Because here's what I can tell you...  If the Rover found us, the Drones will too. Unless you want them to find you, let me get somewhere where I can send a signal. Somewhere far from here. Beech... caught.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: The Drones would kill you. Let me try to stop that.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: You can't trust him!

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: You're wasting time. On Beech, Sykes...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I can fix this.

Speaker: beech
Dialogue: Well, you're the repairman. Jack powers up the bike and gets on. He looks at Julia who hesitates, then she climbs on the back of the bike.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I'll get to the antenna, send a signal with my location. The Tet will call off the search. .You should be safe, for now. Jack starts to go.

Speaker: beech
Dialogue: Jack... What if I told you that I had been to your radiation zones. And what I found there... Would change everything you think you know about the world.

Speaker: sykes
Dialogue: What makes you think he's any different from the others? Beech stares at him a moment, then back out.

Speaker: beech
Dialogue: She does. Beech turns away.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: What happened...? She's staring into the distance where an old WRECK of a RESOURCE GATHERER lies shattered against a cliff-face.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: The Scavs brought it down ten years ago. All. this time, I thought we were at war with the Scavs... but it turns out we were just killing each other. He turns, heads off on foot. After a moment, she follows.

Speaker: jack's voice
Dialogue: I don't think they'll have those on Mars, Honey.

Speaker: victoria's voice
Dialogue: Okay, fine. No dishwasher. How about just you. All the time.

Speaker: jack's voice
Dialogue: Yes. When we get there. ON VICTORIA. Her face totally still. Strangely frozen in the face of this sweet little exchange...

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: What will you do now? Jack doesn't answer. He moves to the edge of the deck, stares out, unwilling to meet her eyes.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: That old man is smart. Those fuel cells, the way he's got them tied in with your device... He could blow the whole station.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Jack, you can't turn them in. He glances at her, shakes his head.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: What do you want from me? I'm just a repairman.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Look, stop, okay? Just --

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: But for you, it was always the stars. You wanted to fly further and faster than any one else.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I don't know who you're talking

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: I'm talking about a man I knew, who was fearless. A man who wouldn't bow out of a fight, ever.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: STOP! You and that old man have this story... Except I know who I am, okay? I know who I am!

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: No, you don't. That thing brainwashed you, it erased your

Speaker: memories
Dialogue: He turns, starts to lean on the old telescope, draws back, staring at the thing like it bit him.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Why do I... what is it about this place?

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Ten days before we got our go- ahead, you asked me to meet you here.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: When I sleep. You're always there. She kisses him.

Speaker: younger jack
Dialogue: There, right there. Take a look. She smiles, puts her eye to the telescope.

Speaker: younger julia
Dialogue: Oh, okay. I don't understand. YOUNGER JACK nervously produces an ENGAGEMENT RING from his pocket.

Speaker: younger jack
Dialogue: Now, pan to the right, slowly...

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: There are a few pages missing, but it's the same book.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Vika, it's me. I'm... all right. I'm coming in. Don't report in to Mission, not until I get back. No response. Dead air. Julia is pressed far back in her seat, watching Jack.

Speaker: jack's voice
Dialogue: .I'm 20 minutes out. A TONE makes Victoria look over. The Tet, checking in.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Go to hell. Beat. Beat.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Vika... the Scavs. They're humans, like us. The war has become some giant... mistake. She turns. The heartbreak in her face clear.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: I saw you. I saw you two.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Stay away from me with the truth! I don't want the truth. I preferred oblivion. Victoria looks up, sees Julia in the distance...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Vika, she was my wife. She looks at the infinite sky, the clouds, and as the TET appears... He steps towards her and she backs towards the edge.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: I told them. The drones will be here. For her. For you.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Then come with me.  Don't you see what it means? There are still people, living on Earth. Surviving on earth. People like us. Victoria hears that and laughs, bitter.

Speaker: victoria
Dialogue: Oh, Jack. I think they made us. Victoria steps backwards. Jack LUNGES forward.

Speaker: nooo1
Dialogue: PETALS are falling towards us from the skytower, and then, so is VICTORIA.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: This is Technician Jack Harper. The signal goes out. Beat. Beat...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: She's dead.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Did you hear what I said? She's dead!

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I want to talk to somebody. Beat.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: DAMN YOU! I want to hear your voice! Beat. Beat. Tet Comm Status: "Communication Ended." He stares at this last transmission. Then looks up to the big map. From all over the sector, DRONES are closing on the Sky Tower. Closing on him.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: We have to go.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Where are we going?

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Beech said to look in the radiation zones. I have to go there.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: And if he's just a crazy old man? Jack looks at her. It'd be a funny moment, but it's not.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I've been wrong about everything else. He dives the ship towards the clouds below.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: There... He punches the throttle. The Bubbleship with Drone 166 attached blasts in the direction of A CLIFF FACE. DRONE 166 gets free of one restraint, rotates so its cannon come to bear on part of the undercarriage. OPENS UP, blasting the storage to bits... And Jack PULLS UP, just clearing the ridge, Drone 166 IMPACTING ROCK. The Drone blasts clear through, CRASHES

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: You okay?

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: No. Jack nods, turns the ship north again. The Bubbleship shaking and smoking. Up ahead, the RIDGELINE approaching. WARNING ALARMS trigger on the Bubbleship's display Claxon-like.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Radiation warning. We're five clicks from the border. Jack makes an adjustment, the Bubbleship SURGES with more speed. It sounds like it's going to tear itself apart.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Jack...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I got this. Jack hits it. They're both propelled back into their seats. The radiation zone coming up fast... They CROSS

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Son of a bitch, old man... Words die on his lips as he tracks the plume of smoke from the downed Drone 166, lifting over a nearby ridge. He turns back to the ruined ship, grabs his carbine.

Speaker: jack's voice
Dialogue: No! Wait! The Repairman hears the voice, even as he flips the switch. He LEAPS BACK, spinning around, his carbine coming off his back, lined on Jack fifteen feet away who

Speaker: julia's voice
Dialogue: Jack!? Julia has just crested the rise, sees the two Jack's. Also understanding...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Julia! Stay back! Jack 2 senses her movement, SPINS and AIMS his rifle as Jack rushes forward --

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I'll be back for you.

Speaker: victoria 2
Dialogue: You're early...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: .Just a bit of a dust up.

Speaker: victoria 2
Dialogue: Are you all right? He nods. She comes over to him. He marvels at her beauty, the simplicity of life here...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I cut myself, I just came by for...

Speaker: victoria 2
Dialogue: I'll get it.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: No, I'll get it. He kisses her. Gentle, loving...

Speaker: victoria 2
Dialogue: We should watch a movie tonight. He sits, looking around himself. He belongs here. He fits here. Victoria munches on something.

Speaker: victoria 2
Dialogue: Hey, you didn't say goodbye.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: This is gonna pinch a little.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I always thought that plateau up there could be for a house someday. I thought about remaining here, letting the rest of humanity run off to Mars. And we'd just stay here. Jack stops himself, realizing how easily he said "we."

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: I'm sorry. Jack...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: No. He moves away from her, lights the fire, it starts to crackle. He gets up and goes, walking down to the lake. She stands near the fire, glad for its warmth, watching him out there, silhouetted in front of the lake. WITH JACK. He stares out over the water. Letting the truth wash over him. And then MUSIC from the grotto... the opening bars to the Temptation's "My Girl."

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: He loved this song. Jack sits, shivering, looking out at the lake. She moves to him, wraps a blanket around him.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: What was he like?

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: He was arrogant, and annoying, and the best man I'd ever known. Some distant part of Jack smiles at that.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I'm not that man.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Shhhhh. Yes you are. She rests her head against on his shoulder, holds him. Simple, caring. His eyes... close.

Speaker: younger jack
Dialogue: We should just tell everybody.

Speaker: younger julia
Dialogue: No, when we come home... They KISS...

Speaker: younger julia
Dialogue: Hey... He looks over, smiles. She's naked under the sheets, happy, smiling back at him.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: We can't stay here. She smiles, nods.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Stay here...

Speaker: beech
Dialogue: The first ones were soldiers, programmed only to kill. Beech slowly, painfully, looks at him. Little emotion in Beech, just resigned recognition.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I'm the weapon of this war. BEECH smiles sardonic, nods.

Speaker: beech
Dialogue: The Tet. The clockmaker God. Such brilliant, complex machinery... For such a simple task. To steal our water, our life... all for fuel.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Why didn't you tell me?

Speaker: beech
Dialogue: Not the kind of news that.  .motivates a man. Beat,then low, defeated.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: The device...?

Speaker: beech
Dialogue: No Drone. It will go on, devouring world, after world...

Speaker: julia's voice
Dialogue: There is a way. Julia stands in the doorway to the library.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: It wants me. Bring me to it.  I'm right. You know I am. It's the only way.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Is it ready? Julia is standing at the entrance to the room. He nods and she approaches, STARES at what will be her coffin.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Julia...

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Let's just do it. She moves to climb in, then turns to Jack and kisses him. It's a kiss filled with a lifetime of kisses missed. Finally, it breaks. She backs away, into the Pod, next to the BOMB. Trembling as the door starts to CLOSE. Suddenly, she's very scared. Fighting back panic.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Dream about us.

Speaker: original jack
Dialogue: So far, from this distance, we're still reading zero heat signatures, no sign of organic life. Did I mention we're still really far away?

Speaker: original victoria
Dialogue: Mission plan has us approaching to one hundred kilometers, doing our initial readouts...

Speaker: original jack
Dialogue: Yes, because everyone knows, if you want to really know something, one hundred kilometers is the best

Speaker: original victoria
Dialogue: Stop. We don't know what it is, if it has intentions.

Speaker: original jack
Dialogue: I think she just made my point --

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Bob, let's prep for outer atmosphere. OUTSIDE, the Bubbleship starts to transform for outer space as it RISES higher and higher...

Speaker: the tet
Dialogue: Technician Harper.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Finally. There you are.

Speaker: the tet
Dialogue: Your ship has converted to space mode. This is not authorized.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I am delivering the survivor from the crash of the NASA ship. ON JACK. The Tet reflected in his eyes.

Speaker: the tet
Dialogue: .Proceed. Jack... exhales. The TINY BUBBLESHIP climbs towards the massive artificial moon as the audio from the flight recorder surrounds him again...

Speaker: original victoria
Dialogue: It could be inert. Anything on it could be long gone by now.

Speaker: original jack
Dialogue: Which is why we need to make contact, before it just blows on by like some...

Speaker: original victoria
Dialogue: Which is why we need to make contact.

Speaker: original victoria
Dialogue: Mission control says maintain one thousand meters. Original Jack touches a control. The Shuttle pushes forward, a little.

Speaker: original jack
Dialogue: This is a once in a lifetime opportunity.

Speaker: original victoria
Dialogue: We have our orders, Jack. We're to let it proceed without --

Speaker: original jack
Dialogue: We are. We're going to let it proceed whereever it's going... He lifts out of his seat, floats back towards the mid- section of the Shuttle.

Speaker: original victoria
Dialogue: Jack...

Speaker: original jack
Dialogue: I'll be right back...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Let's make history. FLASH. The birth of the picture of the two of them, eyes filled with anticipation. The photo in Jack's locker.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: It's okay Bob, I'm scared too. In front of him, a SLOT opens in the Tet wall.

Speaker: the tet
Dialogue: Enter at headway speed only.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Entering at headway speed. He flies into the Tet, carrying the POD.

Speaker: the tet
Dialogue: Leave the survivor and return to your duties. Breathable atmosphere has been provided. A PAD is illuminated for Jack to land.

Speaker: the tet
Dialogue: Leave the survivor and return to your duties.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: You know, you made a mistake, Tet. You left me curious.

Speaker: the tet
Dialogue: Reverse course. Leave the --

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: And right now, I want to see what you're made of... Jack GUNS his ship at the large doors, OPENING UP with canons as he does. In front of him, the door IMPLODES just as Jack's ship reaches it, passing into...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Do you like books, Tet!? I like books. Can I tell you something that I read? BEHIND THE BUBBLESHIP. DRONES detach from the walls of the Tet, beginning pursuit.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: There was a guy named Horatius... and he held a bridge, alone. And when they told him to run, to give up, he said -- BOOM! A drone blast EXPLODES A whole engine of the ship. The Bubbleship goes into an uncontrollable SPIN, headed straight at a WALL...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: .What Horatius said, what his argument was, was this... He opens the pod, revealing... -- BEECH'S BODY, and on his chest the raw BOMB. The nuclear warhead from the odyssey surrounded by ten Deuterium fuel cells.

Speaker: the tet
Dialogue: That is not the Survivor.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: No. BEHIND HIM. The Drones blast away the last bit of the Bubbleship, push through...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: How can a man die...

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Jack?

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: How can man die better Than facing fearful odds, For the ashes of his fathers, And the temples of his gods... The DRONES are on him, weapons lining!

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: Well, almost everyone. A MAN stands at the edge of the water, on the opposite side. He wears the wrecked remains of a worksuit, and carries a pack. It is Jack 2. He's aged three years, his hair has grown, his boots are scavenged. He has travelled a long way, and we know that as he stares across the water, he knows exactly what he is looking at.

Speaker: child
Dialogue: Who is that? ON JULIA. It's been a long journey to this moment for her as well. She smiles.

Speaker: julia
Dialogue: It's your father. Come on, let's go pick him up.
